details: "Off-Balance: This creature lacks sure footing or stability. They no longer threaten or flank other creatures and lose their dexterity bonus to their combat manuever defense (CMD) and skill checks. Spending a move action to regain their footing, moving, or taking a 5-ft. step removes this condition. If an off-balance creature is further knocked off-balance, they are also knocked prone. Creatures that cannot be tripped also cannot be knocked off balance."
title: Uneven Earth | Misstep | Unsteady Steps | Off-Kilter | Lopsided Lean | Poor Form | Off-Balance

details: "Bleed: A creature that is taking bleed damage takes the listed amount of damage at the beginning of its turn (or immediately if it is currently their turn). Bleeding can be stopped by a DC 15 Heal check or through the application of any spell that cures hit point damage (even if the bleed is ability damage). Some bleed effects cause ability damage or even ability drain. Bleed effects do not stack with each other unless they deal different kinds of damage. When two or more bleed effects deal the same kind of damage, take the worse effect. In this case, ability drain is worse than ability damage."
title: Light Blood Loss | Bloodied Lip | Bloodied Nose | A Trickle of Blood | That Nicked Something | "Ouch!"

title: Caught Off-Guard | An Unwary Moment | Surprise! | Abrupt Vulnerability | Sudden Strike | Wide Open | "Ya-ha-ha!"

details: "Dazzled: The creature is unable to see clearly, often because of over stimulation. A dazzled creature takes a -1 penalty on attack rolls and perception checks, and all enemies gain partial concealment (20% miss chance). This has no effect on creatures with precise senses other than vision."
title: Tearing Up | Double Vision | Dirt in the Eye | Blink | Everything's Starting to Spin | Lost Focus | Eye Strain | Squint

details: "Sitting or Kneeling: A creature that is sitting or kneeling takes a +2 bonus to their AC against ranged attacks, and a -2 penalty to their AC against melee attacks. Standing from kneeling or sitting takes the same actions and has the same effects as standing from prone, though it may be done as part of a move. You cannot take a 5-ft. step while kneeling or sitting. Kneeling or sitting behind partial cover will usually grant cover. A creature that is tripped while kneeling or sitting is knocked prone. Creatures that are immune to trip cannot kneel or sit."
title: On Your Knees! |" I Command Thee, Kneel!" | Knocked Flat | In the Knee | Twisted Something | Get Down! | Slipped

details: "Prone: The character is lying on the ground. A prone attacker has a -4 penalty on melee attack rolls and cannot use most ranged weapons (except crossbows). A prone defender gains a +4 bonus to their AC against ranged attacks, and a -4 penalty to their AC against melee attacks. Standing from prone is typically a move actin that provokes attacks of opportunity. You cannot move while prone except by crawling 5 feet as a move action, which provokes attacks of opportunity. Going prone behind partial cover will usually grant cover. Creatures that are immune to trip cannot be prone."
title: Drop! | Get Down! | Knocked Down | Tripped | Floored | Brought Low | *Wilhelm Scream* | Eat Dirt

details: "Blinded: The creature cannot see. It takes a  �2 penalty to Attack rolls and Armor Class, loses its Dexterity bonus to AC (if any), and takes a �4 penalty on most Strength- and Dexterity-based skill checks and on opposed Perception skill checks. All checks and activities that rely on vision (such as reading and Perception checks based on sight) automatically fail. All opponents are considered to have total concealment (50% miss chance) against the blinded character. Blind creatures must make a DC 10 Acrobatics skill check to move faster than half speed. Creatures that fail this check fall prone. Characters who remain blinded for a long time grow accustomed to these drawbacks and can overcome some of them. This condition has no effect on creatures with precise senses other than vision."
title: Dirt in the Eye | Bleeding Eyes | My Eye! | Attack the Darkness | Blackout | Go for the Eyes! | Bull's Eye!

details: "Confused: A confused creature is off guard, doesn't treat anyone as their ally, cannot delay or ready an action, and cannot take immediate actions or attacks of opportunity. At the beginning of each turn, they roll on the confused table to see what they do (act normally, nothing, damage self, or attack nearest creature). If a confused creature was attacked since they last acted normally, and at least one of their attackers is alive and visible, they randomly attack one of their attackers instead of babbling incoherently, damaging themselves, or attacking the nearest creature.
title: Cognitive Chaos | "Wait! What?" | Huh? | Who? | "Duh�" | Where? | How! | Disoriented | Concussion

effect: are Knocked Prone and Knocked Back
details: "Prone: The character is lying on the ground. A prone attacker has a -4 penalty on melee attack rolls and cannot use most ranged weapons (except crossbows). A prone defender gains a +4 bonus to their AC against ranged attacks, and a -4 penalty to their AC against melee attacks. Standing from prone is typically a move actin that provokes attacks of opportunity. You cannot move while prone except by crawling 5 feet as a move action, which provokes attacks of opportunity. Going prone behind partial cover will usually grant cover. Creatures that are immune to trip cannot be prone."
title: Move! | "Out of the Way!" | "Get Back!" | Pushover | Manhandled

quality: Strength Damage | Dexterity Damage | Constitution Damage |Intelligence Damage | Wisdom Damage | Charisma Damage
details: "Ability Damage: For every 2 points of damage you take to a single ability, apply a �1 penalty to skills and statistics listed with the relevant ability. If the amount of ability damage you have taken equals or exceeds your ability score, you immediately fall unconscious until the damage is less than your ability score. The only exception to this is your Constitution score. If the damage to your Constitution is equal to or greater than your Constitution score, you die. Unless otherwise noted, damage to your ability scores is healed at the rate of 1 per day to each ability score that has been damaged. Ability damage can be healed through the use of spells, such as lesser restoration."
title: Severed | Deep in the Abdomen | Brained | Cracked Open

details: "Shaken: A shaken character takes a �2 penalty on attack rolls, saving throws, skill checks, and ability checks. Shaken is a less severe state of fear than frightened or panicked."
title: Terrifying Display | Panic! | Lost Nerve | Broken Morale

details: "Shaken: A shaken character takes a �2 penalty on attack rolls, saving throws, skill checks, and ability checks. Shaken is a less severe state of fear than frightened or panicked."
title: Terrifying Display | Panic! | Lost Nerve | Broken Morale

details: "Frightened: A frightened creature flees from the source of its fear as best it can. If unable to flee, it may fight. A frightened creature takes a �2 penalty on all attack rolls, saving throws, skill checks, and ability checks. A frightened creature can use special abilities, including spells, to flee; indeed, the creature must use such means if they are the only way to escape. Frightened is like shaken, except that the creature must flee if possible. Panicked is a more extreme state of fear."
title: Terrifying Display | Panic! | Lost Nerve | Broken Morale | "Flee for your Life" | "Every Man for Themselves!"

title: Terrifying Display | Panic! | Lost Nerve | Broken Morale | "Flee for your Life" | "Every Man for Themselves!"

details: "Panicked: A panicked creature must drop anything it holds and flee at top speed from the source of its fear, as well as any other dangers it encounters, along a random path. It can�t take any other actions. In addition, the creature takes a �2 penalty on all saving throws, skill checks, and ability checks. If cornered, a panicked creature cowers and does not attack, typically using the total defense action in combat. A panicked creature can use special abilities, including spells, to flee; indeed, the creature must use such means if they are the only way to escape. Panicked is a more extreme state of fear than shaken or frightened."
title: Terrifying Display | Panic! | Lost Nerve | Broken Morale | "Flee for your Life" | "Every Man for Themselves!" | *Whimper*

details: "Cowering: The character is frozen in fear and can take no actions except the Total Defense action, which they must make every turn. They also take a -2 penalty to Armor Class. Cowering is a more extreme state of fear that frightened or panicked."
